components.description:
An abacus, an ancient tool used to count and calculate by moving beads. Depicted as a wooden frame with four or more rows or columns of variously positioned and colored beads.

Used for various content concerning mathematics and science (education) as well as calculations, counting, and numbers more generally.

Designs from Apple and Facebook resemble a Chinese abacus (suanpan), as did a previous Microsoft design. By one reckoning, Apple’s red-beaded design displays the number 108 and Emojipedia's, 12,031,981.
components.title: Abacus

version.description:
Unicode 11.0 was released on June 5, 2018. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page but for the full 2018 emoji list see Emoji 11.0.

Emoji 11.0 includes every new emoji, including variations for skin tone, gender and new emojis that don't require additional code points, such as the chess pawn or pirate flag which are not shown on this page.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the abacus emoji presents a meticulously crafted representation of the ancient calculating tool, rendered with the crispness and detail Apple is known for. Its wooden frame is depicted with subtle grain and realistic lighting, while the beads, in vibrant yet muted colors, slide smoothly along their rods, showcasing Apple's signature glossy 3D shading. This emoji elegantly symbolizes calculation, education, history, and meticulous planning, offering a sophisticated visual cue for discussions involving numbers or traditional methods on Apple devices.
